div.bibl: "For the World's Fair Exposition of Chicago," Vita Nuova (monthly), October 1931, p. 29.

body.p: The committee in charge of the Chicago World Fair has sponsored the broadcasting over station WCFL of an international program in which foreign groups of Chicago were represented. Chev. Dr. A. Lagorio spoke to all Italians of Chicago and the rest of the world over the above station.
The tenor John Panegasser sang a few operatic numbers.
The program was transmitted on both short and long waves.
